title: Everton look resigned to losing Romelu Lukaku and plot swoop for MLS star Cyle Larin as replacement
text:
Rom's replacement Everton look resigned to losing Romelu Lukaku and plot swoop for MLS star Cyle Larin as replacement 
Canadian striker has bagged 32 goals in two seasons as Ronald Koeman eyes move Exclusive 27th March 2017, 12:32 pm Updated: 27th March 2017, 12:32 pm Comments EVERTON have put Cyle Larin on their wanted list as they search for Romelu Lukaku’s replacement. 
The Orlando City striker, 21, has been tracked by Goodison scouts during two prolific seasons in MLS. AP:Associated Press Orlando’s Cyle Larin (back) is being lined up to replace Romelu Lukaku at Everton Getty Images 3 Cyle Larin has continued hos goalscoring form this season bagging three in his first two appearances 
Keep up to date with ALL the Everton news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
And Larin has emerged as an option after establishing himself under ex-Everton striker Adrian Heath at Orlando. 
The Canada striker hit 32 goals in two seasons and has continued his goalscoring form into this campaign with three strikes in his first two appearances. 
Besiktas have also shown interest, with skipper Atiba Hutchinson recommending his international team-mate to the Turkish giants. Larin, who is expected to cost £2million, is set to eventually move to Europe after previously being linked with Celtic and Portuguese giants Benfica and Sporting Lisbon. 
Nottingham Forest and Brighton have also considered him as they look to bolster their Championship squads. But Everton are among the club who believe he could go straight to the top-flight.
